text: Both Dotdigital and our third-party partners may use assorted technologies to collect and store information when you use the Dotdigital platform, visit our website, or interact with an email from us.
Both Dotdigital and our third-party partners may use assorted technologies to collect and store information when you use the Dotdigital platform, visit our website, or interact with an email from us.

When you make an enquiry or contact our support team

We need enough information from you to answer your enquiry.
We record calls for quality and training purposes to ensure we deal with your request as best as possible.
These partners may use cookies or other tracking methods to provide you content or advertisements based upon your browsing activities and interests.
We use cookies, which are small files with a code that is stored on your device, with your consent.

We store customer contracts and related personal information within our internal CRM system, and our legal case management system is shared with internal employees on a need-to-know basis via email and Dropbox.
When you visit our company websites, we collect internet log information and details of visitor behaviour patterns.

These third-party services may collect publicly available contact and social information related to you, such as your name, email address, gender, company, job title, photos, website URLs, social network handles and physical addresses, to enhance your user experience.
This allows Dotdigital to monitor your use of our website, products and services and tracks our relationship so we can improve our service to you.

That information may include either your or your end-users' name, email address, IP address, phone number, postal address, besides other details that may include gender, location, occupation or other information of a demographic nature.
While signing up for and using Dotdigital services, consulting with our support teams, sending us an email, connecting another account with the Dotdigital services (e.g. using one of our technical integrations and connectors), or communicating with us in any way, you are voluntarily giving us information.

That information may include either your or your end-users' name, email address, IP address, phone number, postal address, besides other details that may include gender, location, occupation or other information of a demographic nature.

data_type: information about web browsing of site
text: When you browse one of our websites, use the Dotdigital platform or interact with an email we send to you, we may collect information about your web browsing and use of the site or platform.
Dotdigital may obtain information about you or end-users from third parties, such as public databases, social media platforms, third party data providers and our marketing partners.

That information may include either your or your end-users' name, email address, IP address, phone number, postal address, besides other details that may include gender, location, occupation or other information of a demographic nature.
While signing up for and using Dotdigital services, consulting with our support teams, sending us an email, connecting another account with the Dotdigital services (e.g. using one of our technical integrations and connectors), or communicating with us in any way, you are voluntarily giving us information.

When you make an enquiry or contact our support team

We'll keep a record of your enquiry on Zendesk & intercom, our support ticketing system We use the information supplied to us to deal with the enquiry and any subsequent issues that may arise, and to check on the level of service we provide.

Further to the uses described above, we may aggregate and/or de-identify any information we collect, such that the information no longer identifies any specific individual.
We may use, disclose and otherwise process such information for our own legitimate business purposes without restriction.
This provides us with insights and increases business efficiency.
